summary:
## The Dead Sea Scrolls

The Dead Sea Scrolls are ancient Jewish writings found in caves near the Dead Sea. Discovered between 1946 and 1956, they date back to around 200 BC to AD 100. These scrolls include early versions of books from the Bible, other Jewish texts, and even some in Greek and Aramaic.

Most scholars believe the Essenes, a Jewish group, wrote them. They are mainly in Hebrew, with some in Aramaic and Greek. Today, most of the scrolls are kept in the Israel Museum in Jerusalem.
title: Dead Sea Scrolls
